Approximate Message Passing

Stanford University, Fall 2017

In recent years there have been a great interest in asymptotic message passing (AMP) techniques for simplifying complicated inference problem into a sequence seqeunce of computationally tracktable "local" problems. In addition for being an inference technique, the per-iteration behavior of the AMP algorithm can be reigorously chracterized by a simple state-evolution procedure that leads, under some conditions, to Bayes opitmal solutions. In this seminar series, presenters discuss recent generalizations of AMP and successeses in using AMP for prooving optimality of various inference procedures.

Instructors:

David Donoho
Alon Kipnis

These are notes for Stanford statistics course Approximate Message Passing. For questions/concerns/bug reports, please contact David Donoho or Alon Kipnis.
